events.title: SEC Charges in Insider Trading Case
events.description: The SEC filed a settled civil fraud action against Epstein and others for illegal insider trading in publicly-traded Massachusetts banks.

keyFacts: Jeffrey S. Epstein is identified as a defendant in a settled insider trading case.
The SEC charged Epstein and four associates for illegal insider trading in three Massachusetts banks.
The defendants agreed to pay over $437,000 in disgorgement and penalties.
Allen M. Glick was a former director of MetroWest Bank and Banknorth Group, Inc.
The document includes personal details about Epstein, including his birth date and nationality.
